intro: Gomidesia tijucensis, commonly known as the Tijucense plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
